subtests.name: Constructing a CSSHSL with a number for the hue works as intended.
CSSHSL.h can be updated with a a number.
Constructing a CSSHSL with degrees for the hue works as intended.
CSSHSL.h can be updated with a degrees.
Constructing a CSSHSL with radians for the hue works as intended.
CSSHSL.h can be updated with a radians.
Constructing a CSSHSL with gradians for the hue works as intended.
CSSHSL.h can be updated with a gradians.
Constructing a CSSHSL with undefined for the hue works as intended.
CSSHSL.h can be updated with a undefined.
Constructing a CSSHSL with css pixels for hue throws a SyntaxError.
Constructing a CSSHSL with css em for hue throws a SyntaxError.
CSSHSL can be constructed from three numbers and will get an alpha of 100%.
CSSHSL can be constructed from four numbers.
Constructing a CSSHSL with CSS.number for s, l or alpha throws a TypeError
Updating a CSSHSL with CSS.number for s throws a SyntaxError
CSSHSL.s can be updated to a number.
CSSHSL.s can be updated with a CSS percent.
Updating a CSSHSL with CSS.number for l throws a SyntaxError
CSSHSL.l can be updated to a number.
CSSHSL.l can be updated with a CSS percent.
Updating a CSSHSL with CSS.number for alpha throws a SyntaxError
CSSHSL.alpha can be updated to a number.
CSSHSL.alpha can be updated with a CSS percent.
